goal_descEN: Promote peaceful and inclusive societies for sustainable development, provide access to justice for all and build effective, accountable and inclusive institutions at all levels
target_descEN: Significantly reduce all forms of violence and related death rates everywhere
indicator_descEN: Proportion of population that feel safe walking alone around the area they live
seriesDescription: Proportion of population that feel safe walking alone around the area they live (%)
footnotes: Safe when walking alone after dark. Includes persons who reported feeling very safe from crime when walking alone after dark in their neighbourhood. Individuals who reported never walking alone after dark were excluded from the calculation of the proportions. Source: Statistics Canada, General Social Survey, 2014.

goal_descEN: Promote peaceful and inclusive societies for sustainable development, provide access to justice for all and build effective, accountable and inclusive institutions at all levels
target_descEN: Significantly reduce all forms of violence and related death rates everywhere
indicator_descEN: Proportion of population that feel safe walking alone around the area they live
seriesDescription: Proportion of population that feel safe walking alone around the area they live (%)
footnotes: Data from Gallup poll, with national sample of persons age 18 or older, using RDD methods to sample landline and cellular telephone numbers. The proportion of the permanent resident population over the age of 16 who feels safe. The feeling of insecurity has been defined as: a feeling of insecurity on the way or at work, and the fear of becoming victims of attacks or physical aggression.
